Lyrics:

Run and tell all of the angels
This could take all night
Think I need a devil to help me get things right

Hook me up a new revolution
'Cause this one is a lie
We sat around laughing and watched the last one die

Now I'm looking to the sky to save me
Looking for a sign of life
Looking for something to help me burn out bright
I'm looking for a complication
Looking 'cause I'm tired of lying
Make my way back home when I learn to fly high."


#FooFighters #LearnToFly #OfficialVideo #HDremastered
column9:
['I__ just realising how great Dave grohls acting in this is. I watched it a million times when I was younger but only just realised how great he was in it.', 'Producers: "So which role do you want in the music video?"
Dave: "Yes!"', 'Rest in Peace Taylor. Foo Fighters won't be the same without you. Your genius work on the drums cannot be replaced. Fly high Taylor Hawkins.', 'Can we bring this back? This feeling? This music? This vibe. The world needs more of this.', 'Foo Fighters were incredibly important for me during the worst of my depression when I was younger. Forever grateful for all the love you poured into every song with your drums, Taylor. You'll live in every song, forever.', 'This song. This was the moment I was hooked on Foo Fighters forever. Taylor will ALWAYS make an excellent woman. I hope he's carrying on his antics up there. RIP Taylor. The earth is a hell of a lot darker place today without you.', 'We need more Dave's in the world. Who else could flirt and make fun of himself across several different roles in a 4 minute video?', 'Hands down one of the greatest music videos of all time.', 'Didn't think it was possible to have an ugly cry while listening to this song but here I am. Love and respect to the Foo Fighters family.', 'I cannot believe that the energetic force behind the drums, Taylor Hawkins, is no more. It's truly a great loss for not only modern rock n' roll music but music in general. And I can't imagine how hard it must be for the band members and his close loved ones... This song was the first one that came to mind for its uplifting feel.. RIP Taylor!']

#FooFighters #Everlong #OfficialHDVideo #Remastered
column9:
['Dad died today. \r
1:20 am.\r
A five day battle with brain cancer. \r
I played this song for hours on a $49 dollar acoustic guitar beside his death bed.\r
He couldn't talk but I know he could hear.\r
It was the last song he ever heard,
and it was an honor to play it for you.\r
I'll miss you forever dad.

Edit: Your comments saved my life. Thank you.

;', 'First concert I ever went to at Bamboozle in 2012, Ill never forget Dave saying
"you don't need all these fancy lights and equipment, you can do this too, anyone can do this''\xa0
changed my life forever', 'There's something about that intro that just pumps you up no matter how many times you hear it...', 'Stop asking who's still listening, we never stop listening.This song is one of those songs that just stays in your memory, forever.', 'When my brother died of leukemic cancer, he was wearing his headphones with his eyes closed and a smile on his face, this song was ringing on his phone. Whenever it sounds or I listen to it again, it reminds me of that scene and I wonder "If everything could ever be this real forever\r
If anything could ever be this good again". Miss you Chris You have no idea how much i miss you', 'RIP Taylor Hawkins, the incredible beating heart of the Foo Fighters has gone.', 'I'm not even a huge Foo Fighters fan but this song is undeniably one of the greatest of all time.', 'My uncle died from a drinking problem. He listened to this song almost all the time, one day I saw him cleaning his nails and Everlong was there. Damn, I just wish he could hear it again. At his funeral, I had headphones on listening to this while I was in pieces.

Thank you, Uncle M. I will never forget your teachings to me and my cousins. Today I am a man thanks to you. Thank you.', 'Just read the news about Taylor Hawkins passing away_ love to watch this again because him bursting out of the bed /drum kit was such a memorable part of this video. Rest well and much love to Dave and the Foo__.', 'This is one of those songs I can listen to over and over and never get tired of, anyone else feel the same?']

column9:
['So thankful for this awesome song. I'll be gone soon (when my kidneys fail completely), but what am I listening to in the meantime? This song. Screaming out the lyrics right along with Dave. Because I'm still here now, and I still have a voice, and I will also never surrender. Not until it's my time.

Always loved this song; never knew it would become my anthem in my final days. Thanks, Dave.', 'The intro will always give me goosebumps, Foo Fighters were my first favorite band as a kid. Still hold a special place for me.', 'RIP Taylor Hawkins, incredible loss and gone way too young', 'Thanks dad for showing me this masterpiece, for gifting me these awesome music tastes. I feel I can fly.', 'This guy is a drummer, singer, guitarist, Jesus, and Johnwick all at the same time...', 'the rest of the lyrics from the description:

Keep you in the dark
You know they all pretend
Keep you in the dark
And so it all began

Send in your skeletons
Sing as their bones go marching in again
They need you buried deep
The secrets that you keep are ever ready

Spinning infinity
But the wheel is spinning me
It's never ending, never ending
Same old story

What if I say I'm not like the others?
What if I say I'm not just another one of your plays?
You're the pretender
What if I say that I will never surrender?

In time, or so I'm told

Same old story

I'm the voice inside your head

I'm what's left, I'm what's right
I'm the enemy
I'm the hand that'll take you down
Bring you to your knees

So, who are you? Yeah, who are you?
Yeah, who are you? Yeah, who are you?

Keep you in the dark, you know they all pretend

What if I say I'm not like the others?
What if I say I'm not just another one of your plays?
You're the pretender
What if I say I will never surrender?

#FooFighters #MyHero #OfficialHDVideo #RemasteredÔª
column9:
['My son and I was supposed to spend the summer learning this song. He was a drummer and I was a on guitar. My 12 year old son Tristan Van Lu passed away on 3/22/23. He was the best drummer I have ever met, he was my hero. I rocked this song out at his funeral, it was the last time I will ever touch a guitar again. Played until my fingers bled my boy!. I love you so much my son, my best friend I will never forget you and will never stop missing you my son....', 'I like how you never see his face. The real heroes are the good people everyday who go unnoticed doing heroic things. The real heroes are the people you don__ even know are heroes', '"There goes my hero. Watch him as he goes..."

That line. I will never listen to that line the same ever again. The lose of Taylor Hawkins, the drummer and the beating heart of Foo Fighters, was truly tragic. No matter how good of a replacement they may find, you'll never really be replaced.

He was an ordinary man to some, but a true hero to most. Rest in peace, keep on rockin' Taylor.', 'My sister was 8 months old stuck in a burning apartment complex in Kansas City a random man ran in to save her. I__e never got to say how thankful I am to him I wish him the best my sister is 13 now! She__ an amazing talented kid thank you sir if you ever see this my family will always be grateful for your existence', 'Rest in Peace Taylor Hawkins, Truly a great musician who was gone too soon, May you rest in peace', 'No more fitting song to listen to than My Hero after the absolutely heartbreaking news of the loss of Taylor. Rock in peace, man. You made a difference.', 'Can't believe we lost a legend today, it's amazing how people are here paying their respects immediately. A true inspiration he was.', 'Imagine your house is on fire. You run inside to save whatever you can, but the Foo Fighters are just rocking out in your living room as loud as they can.', 'we played this song at my dad's funeral. after we ran out of things to say to him when he was sedated in hospice, i started singing to him, songs he liked. this one stuck out to my mom, and we chose it to commemorate him. thank you, foo fighters, for this amazing song. i'll always associate it with my pops.', 'Man that is messed up, he saved all those people but let the foo fighters burn.']

column9:
['The emotion in his face and his voice transcends so many levels of the soul. He really is pouring his whole heart out into this song !!', 'We can never replace Taylor. How does a man have the balls enough to sit on the kit behind the greatest rock star of our time, and do it so well. RIP Talor Hawkins. Miss your vibrant character and raw power to entertain. Love you. Best to your family and friends.', 'This song really helped me through some difficult times in my life.... hope Dave and Taylor¬¥s family find recovery soon', '____¶Ë________10_∞Âπ¥_¶‚
‰ª______∫¶_________', '0:46
The drums kicking in during "I needed somewhere to hang my head" is spectacular. Lots of times when I listen to songs I feel like the drums are the equivalent of a minor supporting actor. Here it's one of the main stars.', 'What a talent Dave is. Drummer, singer, guitarist, and love maker to mics.', 'A truly masterpiece of resilience song. Thank you Dave and to all of his band.', 'If it wasn__ for the Foo Fighters, I would not be there today. They helped. me. Through the worst time of my life, I love the Foo Fighters, bush, and Chevelle and disturbed. I would not be here without the Foo Fighters. I love them so much and I know they know it.', 'This song is amazing, I suffer from cancer and it helped me through a lot of bad times. I love you, Dave!', 'My son played this song next to my ear when I was recovering from heart surgery. What a great thing to do. Love you for it']

column9: ['This song is a timeless classic, I don't think anyone will ever get bored of it .', 'When people say this songs makes people feel better people don__ realise that this was written after he found out he was being cheated on, so he made a draft that night and most of the lyrics weren__ changed as he wanted it to be as close to how he felt in that moment as he could, so at one of this legends lowest times he made a song that will be timeless and I have full respect and hope that this will never be forgotten', '1:42 the way he says "juST FINe" is a whole mood', 'Unbelievable master piece, the sound of my youth.', 'Still as amazing as the day it was released. Loved it ever since.', 'This will always be one of my favorite songs.', 'It really is true__his track has maintained the same emotional power and relevance for almost 15 years. Every time I hear it, I feel myself reliving a thousand other days when this track helped me to calmly analyze a difficult situation or time. Never has a song had more therapeutic value like Mr. Brightside.', 'This song is still on the UK charts. Certified banger', 'there__ something about this song that is just different and no matter how many times u listen to it, it never gets old.', 'the killers really made a song about getting cheated on that has one verse which is repeated twice and its one of the best songs ever created']

#TheKillers #WhenYouWereYoung #Remastered #Vevo #AlternativeRock #OfficialMusicVideo #Indie
column9:
['My boyfriend who passed away a few weeks ago sang this song when we were at a bar doing karaoke one night. Since he sang it that night, I had been trying to figure out the name of it; I finally came across it tonight. The song has so much meaning to me. We were together for five years and were both young when he sung this song. Now I just watch the video of him in my phone when he sang this song that night at the bar, wishing he was still alive, wishing that we could go back in time to when we were young. R.I.P. Chris, I'll always love you.', 'the serenity of the part that says, "They say the devil's water, it ain't so sweet. You don't have drink right now, but you can dip your feet, every once in the little while," in Guitar Hero was what drew me to this song. Now its nearly 8 years later and I haven't found anything as enchanting as that part.
The Killers is one hell of a band.', '"Sometimes you close your eyes and see the place where you used to live" kills me every time', 'Vivo a unos cuantos kil√≥metros de donde se grabo este video (Tlayacapan Morelos- M√©xico) y realmente es incre√≠ble ver c√≥mo este video tiene ese toque especial que le caracteriza a la banda y al lugar en si, simplemente Perfecto y m√°gico! Gracias The Killers por este momento _§Ô_', 'I'm 28 and the song hits harder and harder. I have a lot of regrets about decisions I made in my life don't waste your years guys, and enjoy everything with the people you love.', 'You truly don__ appreciate the intensity of this song until you__e come back to it a decade later, having lived some life and experienced some heartbreak.', 'The opening guitar riff at 1:28 never fails to give me goosebumps. Incredible tune.', 'God bless everyone! Peace and love for the world!', 'As you get older, this song takes on new meaning and hit you harder. That's what makes this a classic.', 'This is absolutely THE most poignant and captivating video for a song I have ever seen. She doesn__ speak a word, but her body and especially her eyes tell you her joy, her pain, and at the cross, she is asking __hy?_ when he is holding her. And yes, she is beautiful.']

column9:
['Mr Brightside is their most catchy and well known song but this. This is the one that gets me hype.', 'Nobody:
My brain at midnight: Hey remember this song? This song you haven't heard in years? Listen to it. Listen to it now.', '"Never thought I'd let a rumour ruin my moonlight"
most beautiful line ever.
That, and "I'm coming out of my cage, and I'm doing just fine"', 'It's 2024, and the album Hot Fuss is 20 year old now, but it still has the same vibe like in 2004. Absolutely masterpiece!', '2:05-2:25 is my favorite part of the song. Flowers does that bellowing, dragged out singing style on several songs, and it always works. So full of emotion and heartbreak.', 'no one ever talks about how the drummer of the killers he has the power to lead the song and to blend in perfectly it's one of the great talents iv seen.', '00:21

A rushing, rushing around', 'This song has marked the beginning of one of my life-defining decisions. It will forever be my favourite from The Killers.', 'This song never gets old....straight up masterpiece', 'For anyone wondering, Brandon Flowers actually said in an interview that this song is about the process of trying to write a song! "Breaking my back just to know your name" is him trying to write a title or lyrics to a song, "you had a boyfriend who looked like a girlfriend that I had" is him saying that even after finishing writing a song it's frustrating for someone to say they heard another song that sounds similar. It's kinda hard for me to explain all in one comment, but you can look this song up on Genius lyrics if you want to get the full answer!']

column3:
REMASTERED IN 4K HD!!
Official Music Video for Crossfire performed by Brandon Flowers.

(C) 2010 The Island Def Jam Music Group

#BrandonFlowers #Crossfire #Remastered
column9:
['He__ one of the most underrated vocalists ever! He__ amazing.', 'Jesus Christ this song is actually beautiful! The lyrics really got me.. Ten years ago when this was released I was too busy drooling over Brandon on this video but now I'm actually paying more attention to the lyrics and they speak to me a lot more now that I'm older.', 'Here after hearing it first 10 years ago. This vid is such a perfect metaphor of the struggle of love and how the true feeling means that whenever one of the couple is down or has done something stupid, the other one shows up to just save the day and the love itself. And it does not need to be extreme saving: it can be patience when your partner is in bad mood, getting him/her up and showing the direction. It happened to me so many times when I was down and my wife just stood there by my when my demons possessed me, patiently not shouting at me - and lifted me up eventually. Thank you, Kasia.', 'If this was a real movie, I would have rewatch it countless of times already ____
Theron and Brandon have a good chemistry here. A savior warrior.', 'Brandon Flowers has one of the prettiest manly voices EVER', 'His smile gets me every time. It always makes me smile back when he does it. It's perfect.', 'Brandon Flowers, I send this thanks to u, u gave my dad some of his 'love for music' on his funeral. This song was played on repeat on my phone and mind over these last few days... And I just want to thank u for this amazing song. Thank you, R.I.P dad xx', 'What a gorgeous man and definitely one of the most talented vocalists ever.', 'Been a fan of the killers since the very beginning and they have a even bigger place in my heart now. They helped me through a troubled worrisome pregnancy and now that my beautiful healthy girl is finally here i think of her whenever I listen to brandons' sweet calming voice.

Not many bands can do that to somebodys heart.

Hope she will be a big fan like her mummy. She did she them live in vegas at 16 weeks gestation after all. :)', 'Hahaha Charlize be like "Brandon, do I REALLY have to keep saving you from these ninjas ."']

Do you have the time
To listen to me whine
About nothing and everything all at once?
I am one of those
Melodramatic fools

My best friend who introduced me to Green Day back in 1998 when I was only 14. Sadly, I recently found out that he drowned in the ocean a few years ago, leaving being a little daughter. He was a genuine wonderful person who, inspired by Green Day, dreamed of starting a Punk Rock band as a kid. We are all anonymous statistics who pass through this world on our journey to self realization, I want to leave his name here for posterity in honor of our friendship.', 'Fun Facts: This song is about anxiety attacks and a feeling that you are going crazy. column9:
['20 years and it all went by in a flash _The American Idiot 20th Anniversary Super Deluxe Edition is out now ____ Go give it a listen or grab a copy https://greenday.lnk.to/americanidiot20thdeluxe', 'I__ 15, exploring new genres, I luv this

Edit/Update: All you guys are awesome. I__ now in college and this has been my favorite song since then. Thank you all for the different song and band suggestions!
Also back then, I meant to say exploring __ifferent_ genres not new if that caused some confusion.', 'The 90's feel so different. Not just a nostalgic thing, but like we crossed a threshold into another world that we can never come back from. Everything feels so different.', 'A song thats eternally good, a one in a billion classic in the music industry.', 'Green Day aged like a fine wine. I absolutely love their music.', 'There are certain 90__ songs that give me an overwhelmingly painful and bittersweet sense of nostalgia. This is definitely one of them.', 'This song KICKED ASS in 1994.
This song KICKS ASS in 2016.
In short, this song has been KICKIN' ASS for 22 years, and will KICK ASS till the end of time!!!', 'Me and a really good friend of mine from high school bonded because of Green day, we ditched school a lot, discovered our shared love of weed and started a punk band. Us and our little group of friends ended up going our separate ways in life when we reached our 20's. I carried on playing in bands, while he joined the army for a while, he didn't pursue the music thing and I didn't hear from him for years after that.

A couple of years ago, he walked into a bar I was working at and we caught up, When I come around came on the speakers and we reminisced about the times spent goofing off listening to Dookie. About a week after that I got a message from his mother telling me he had taken his own life, and that it'd mean a lot if I went to his funeral as he always talked about those years as some of his happiest.

I haven't listened to Green day for years. But since then, this album sounds completely different and it now brings me to tears. Not communicating with him for years is always going to be one of my biggest regrets, if you have an old friend you haven't heard from in a while you should reach out to them, you could have a bigger impact than you realise.

I don't know why I wrote this, I never normally comment on anything but it felt right to share for whatever reason.', 'To think in 3 years this song will be 30. The 90s seems like another world at this point.', 'I miss my bro, we use to walk the town or city and he would play this and always ran chills down my back, rip mike.']

column9: ['20 years and it all went by in a flash _The American Idiot 20th Anniversary Super Deluxe Edition is out now ____ Go give it a listen or grab a copy https://greenday.lnk.to/americanidiot20thdeluxe', 'I remember getting this album when I was 10 and my mum wouldn't let me get the uncensored version. The guy at the music shop saw how much I wanted the uncensored version swapped the discs and when I got home I realised and only listened with headphones. What a legend.', 'A Green Day song that just gets better with age. Thats quite common with this band. Songs that stand the test of time.', 'This song never stops being relevant.', 'Little did anyone know that when this song came out in 2004, it was heralding the modern American life. I mean, the lyrics were important then, but its insane how well they've stood the test of time and become more and more resonant in the past 17 years. A new kind of tension, the age of paranoia, do the propaganda, etc. Era defining music right here', '20 years and I'm back here listening to this to cope with the stress of today (election day in the US). Thanks for being there all this time, Greenday.', '20 years and we__e all here', 'Perfect song, perfect clip for this day, 20 years later, nothing changes', 'To those saying this song is relevant now.... it__ been relevant since before it was written', 'Don't know why, but I was just watching the debate between Trump and Biden the other day and this song popped out on my head and it hasn't left ever since.']

column9:
['20 years and it all went by in a flash _The American Idiot 20th Anniversary Super Deluxe Edition is out now ____ Go give it a listen or grab a copy https://greenday.lnk.to/americanidiot20thdeluxe', 'Short story behind the song...

Green Day lead singer Billie Joe Armstrong wrote this song about his father, who died of cancer on September 1, 1982 when Billie was just 10 years old. At his father's funeral, Billie cried, ran home and locked himself in his room. When his mother got home and knocked on the door to Billie's room, Billie simply said, "Wake me up when September ends," hence the title.

Pretty darn sad but awesome of BJA at the same time.

If that's true... Is pretty cool.', 'This song was in my 25 year old sons phone. He died on 9-23-2014. His summers will never end. My heart just breaks everyday, but hes never gonna feel pain again. Just love. I've been raising his son, as my grandfather did for me. Hes 9 now and i recognize everyday, hes just like his dad. I got a do-over, but ive give my life for them to grow up together. Honor the tears, they cleanse the soul..', '"20 years has gone so fast"
This album is officially 20 years old this year. It really did go by so fast... ___', 'I was in 4th grade. My dad takes me to see my favorite band in concert. Green Day during the American Idiot tour. Almost 20 years ago. Been one year since I lost my dad already. Really has gone by so fast_ Thank you Green Day for the memories', 'Billie, the singer, wrote this about his father who tragically died in September when he was 10. He said, __ake Me Up When September Ends_, to his mother when she checked on him after he ran home from the funeral because he couldn__ handle it. 7 years after his father passed, he joined Green Day, and 20 years after his dad passed, he and Green Day wrote the song.
People absolutely can joke about this song, I__ just explaining the meaning of the title if anyone is curious.

Edit: Thank you for all the likes! Green Day fans are the best!

Edit in 2024. Crazy how like the lyrics in this song go, _20 years has gone so fast,_ this album and song officially turn 20 years old this September 21st! 20 years really has gone so fast! Green Day forever!! ________

PS The 4K upgrade is absolutely amazing!', 'I had cancer at 12 years old in 2006. Spend my birthday in the hospital at the end of August 2006. The doctors told me & my parents that I would be able to leave the hospital at the end of September if everything was okay. I already was a fan of Green Day at the time. This song became special to me. I'm 30 right now & completely healed.
Reading all the comments from so many people who have a special story with this song shows how important & unique it is. Thanks Green Day.', 'My grandma passed away yesterday. This song was playing on the radio later in the evening as I was driving back home. Never new the meaning of this song until that moment. Now this song will always remind me of her. Rest in peace abuela', 'I never saw the end of this video. I was always crying. She waited for him. I never knew that.', 'My dad died of cancer yesterday, And this is is only song I can listen to.
I can relate to this song on the deepest level now.']
